thread.title: RPI hockey shut out in opener
thread.title_full: RPI hockey shut out in opener - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: RPI hockey shut out in opener
text:
Host UMass Lowell dominated the first two periods and went on to post a convincing 3-0 victory over RPI in a men's college hockey season opener at Paul E. Tsongas Center in Lowell, Mass., on Friday night.
The River Hawks outshot the Engineers 38-27 in the nonconference contest and 31-14 in the first two periods as they built a 3-0 lead partly on the strength of two power-play goals.
Michael Louria and Evan Campbell scored in the first period and Adam Chapie added an insurance goal in the middle period.
RPI got 35 saves from goalkeeper Jason Kasdorf , including 28 in the first two periods.
Kevin Boyle stopped 27 shots for the River Hawks to record the shutout.
The victory was the 100th for head coach Norm Bazin of UMass Lowell.
RPI will host nationally top-ranked Boston College at 2 p.m. on Sunday at the Houston Field House .
More Information
UMASS LOWELL 3, RPI 0
RPI 0 0 0—0
UMass Lowell 2 1 0—3
First period—1, UML, Louria (1) (Campbell), 2, UML, Campbell (1) pp (unassisted). Penalties—Wilson, RPI (hooking) 3:31; Folin, UML (interference) 7:08; Cambpell, UML (boarding) 13:48; Lijegren, RPI (elbowing) 19:14.
Second period—3, UML, Chapie (1) pp (Kapla, Master). Penalties—Bubela, RPI (cross-checking) :35; Kapla, UML (holding the stick) 4:17; Lijegren, RPI (hooking) 5:05; Chapie, UML (elbowing) 8:11.
Third period—No scoring. Penalties—Wood, RPI (tripping) 3:44; Folin, UML (hooking) 10:42.
Shots on goal—RPI 7-7-13—27; UMass Lowell 15-16-7—38.
Power-play opportunities—RPI 0-for-5; UMass Lowell 2-for-4.
Goalies—RPI, Kasdorf 13-15-7 (38 shots-35 saves); UMass Lowell, Boyle 7-7-13 (27-27).
T—2:07. A— 5,786.
